title: MS spikes 500+ every 30 seconds?

replies.body:
1. Turn your Router/Modem off for 20-30 seconds than reboot it back up and test if the ping is better in a custom game.

2. Try contacting your ISP about your internet service plan you're paying for. If you had 40-60 ms normally and recently have been getting 500+ ms, it may be on there end. You will have to see what's going on with the download/upload speed plan.
Use recommended settings and run it through the compatibility mode program. Since you state that it does not affect other services, it may help through troubleshooting it the method I mentioned.

Big changes in your latency are often caused by ISP routing changes to the server. Because different services and game servers are in different geolocations, it's conceivable to have a good connection to one but not another. Since local network settings can also impact your connection, I recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) as a first step, along with the network power cycle that *Yxsuo* recommended in their reply.

If your latency is still problematic, please let me know.
